Nick Mangold dies at 41 after kidney battle; former Jets star’s net worth revealed
description: Beloved New York Jets center Nick Mangold has passed away at 41 due to chronic kidney disease complications. Mangold, a seven-time Pro Bowler and two-time All-Pro, recently revealed he was on dialysis and seeking a kidney donor. His decade-long career with the Jets was marked by exceptional leadership and toughness, leaving a significant legacy.

title: Israel strikes southern Lebanon; kills 2 Hezbollah operatives
description: The IDF announced Sunday it killed two Hezbollah operatives in southern Lebanon, targeting individuals involved in weapons procurement and local representation. These strikes occurred amid ongoing border tensions and alleged violations of the November 2024 ceasefire. The operation coincided with a visit by the Israeli defense minister and a US envoy to the Lebanon border.

Real Madrid end El Clasico woes; defeat Barcelona 2-1 at Santiago Bernabeu
description: Real Madrid surged five points clear in La Liga after a thrilling 2-1 El Clásico victory over Barcelona at the Bernabéu. Jude Bellingham netted the winner, building on Kylian Mbappé's opener, as Xabi Alonso's men overcame Barcelona's possession dominance. As Barcelona battled the challenges with key absences, Madrid showcased their resilience and clinical finishing to secure a crucial win.

Despite this, he's had a phenomenal start to the season, averaging 46 points. With LeBron James also sidelined, the Lakers face a thin rotation, relying heavily on Austin Reaves and new additions. The game's outcome could significantly impact early Pacific Division momentum.

Mangold's toughness, loyalty, and leadership defined an era for the franchise.

description: Pakistan reported five soldiers and 25 militants killed in border clashes with Afghanistan, despite ongoing peace talks in Istanbul. The military questioned the timing of these attacks, suggesting doubts about the interim Afghan government's commitment to curbing terrorism. Islamabad has urged Kabul to manage its borders effectively and prevent Afghan soil from being used against Pakistan.

Women lead full-time MBA applications: Growth seen worldwide; flexible programmes rise
description: Women have surpassed men in applications to full-time MBA programmes worldwide, according to the GMAC 2025 Application Trends Survey. Full-time, two-year MBA programmes saw 63% of schools reporting growth in female applicants, while online and flex MBA programmes also experienced increases. Women make up roughly 41% of full-time MBA applicants and dominate Master of Marketing and Accounting applications. Executive MBA and Master of Finance programmes remain male-dominated. Flexible and online formats continue to attract higher female representation globally.

The in-form batter hobbled off, raising concerns about her availability for the crucial semifinal against Australia.  Rawal's absence would be a major blow, given her stellar performances, including a recent century.

He emphasized that experience and passion for red-ball cricket are more important than age, citing seasoned players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. Rahane also advised young talent Sarfaraz Khan to focus on scoring runs and controlling what he can.

title: Flying into the US? You will be photographed; entered into facial recognition database
description: US Customs and Border Protection will expand its biometric tracking, photographing nearly all non-US citizens entering or departing the country. This new rule, effective soon, aims to enhance national security and combat fraudulent travel by creating a comprehensive facial-recognition database.  It eliminates previous age exemptions and applies to all non-citizens, including lawful permanent residents.

Explained: Why Canada's visa system is facing a meltdown
description: Canada's immigration system is facing unprecedented challenges as visa rejections surge across visitor, study, and work categories in 2025. This sharp decline, impacting hundreds of thousands of potential arrivals, is attributed to the increased use of automated decision-making tools like Chinook, leading to generic refusal letters and concerns about fairness and transparency.

title: Delhi horror: 'Stalker' throws acid at 20-year-old student; probe launched
description: A 20-year-old woman from Mukundpur, Delhi, was injured in an acid attack by three men, including acquaintance Jitender, following a month-old argument. She sustained burns on both hands and is admitted to Deep Chand Bandhu Hospital. Police have registered a case under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS), and the Crime and FSL teams are investigating the incident.

Explained: TN Private Universities Amendment Bill; reasons behind the backlash
description: The Tamil Nadu Private Universities (Amendment) Bill 2025 has sparked backlash from universities, students, and stakeholders due to changes in approvals, governance, and compliance. Key concerns include retroactive validation of past notifications, stricter oversight, alignment of medical courses with NMC standards, and rigid requirements for sponsoring bodies. Following widespread objections, the Education Minister announced a review of the Bill. The government aims to balance regulatory clarity with operational flexibility while ensuring legal and national compliance for private universities.

description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent announced a substantial framework to prevent 100% tariffs on Chinese goods and defer rare earths export controls. High-level talks in Kuala Lumpur preceded this development, aiming for more balanced trade, agricultural purchases, and fentanyl crisis measures. The framework is expected to be finalized by Presidents Trump and Xi.

title: 6 years after receiving arrears, retired employees told to repay - until this SC ruling
description: The Supreme Court has ruled in favor of five retired Odisha judiciary employees, quashing a demand to repay salary arrears received six years prior. The apex court stated that surplus payments cannot be reclaimed from employees if they were not involved in fraud or misrepresentation, emphasizing equity and preventing undue hardship.

title: Dindigul readers’ mail
95% of Kerala’s Alappuzha–Changanassery road work completed
description: Almost all major works have been finished, except for Pallathuruthy bridge, which is expected to be completed in the next couple of months. Project aims to prevent  flooding of AC road during monsoon season

description: He also urged party workers to seek clear reasons for any names removed from the rolls.

description: Even as the Commerce Minister visits Brussels, a delegation from the European Parliament will visit New Delhi to explore FTA issues.

title: Galahad, Skagen and Echoes Of Time shine
Explained: Why PM's Bihar campaign start is a calculated political move
description: Prime Minister Modi launched the NDA's Bihar campaign in Mithilanchal, strategically invoking Karpoori Thakur's legacy to appeal to the Extremely Backward Classes (EBCs). This region, with its significant electoral weight and volatile voting patterns, is crucial for the NDA's path to power. Development projects and cultural pride are also key elements of their outreach.

Hanle protects its dark skies and builds a future on stargazing

title: Satish Shah’s final moments: ‘Ek niwala khaye, phir collapse ...’
description: Veteran actor Satish Shah, 74, passed away on October 25 due to kidney failure, leaving fans and colleagues in mourning. His manager revealed he collapsed during his last meal. Shah had undergone a kidney transplant a few months prior but had appeared to be recovering.

title: Job Mela in Tirupati aims to boost employment for youth
description: A Job Mela in Srikalahasti — a part of Andhra Pradesh’s goal of creating 20 lakh jobs for youth — on October 25 connected 312 candidates with 15 companies, resulting in 163 job offers

description: Hyderabad Police Commissioner VC Sajjanar declared drunk drivers as terrorists following a tragic bus fire that killed 20 people in Kurnool. He emphasized that the incident, caused by an intoxicated biker, was a preventable massacre, not an accident. Sajjanar vowed a zero-tolerance approach to drunk driving in Hyderabad, stating such acts will be punished as crimes.

GM layoffs: Engineers fired on Microsoft Teams; Says it's business, not you
description: General Motors has let go of over 200 salaried employees, mainly CAD engineers, at its Michigan tech campus. This move, part of a restructuring to boost profits, follows strong third-quarter earnings and a raised financial outlook. GM stated the layoffs target execution roles to enhance core design capabilities. This comes as the automotive sector sees broader workforce reductions.

Authorities have apprehended both accused in connection with the alleged rape and abetment of suicide.

Understanding metastatic prostate cancer in men over 70
description: Prostate cancer screening for men over 70 is complex, with current recommendations against routine PSA testing due to slow growth and treatment side effects. However, evolving life expectancies prompt expert calls for updated guidelines. Metastatic prostate cancer, which has spread beyond the prostate, is more serious and requires management rather than a cure.

description: Microsoft is revamping GitHub to tackle AI coding rivals like Cursor and Claude Code. CEO Satya Nadella highlighted the need to unify development tools, drawing parallels to Bill Gates' past vision.  The platform aims to integrate AI across all developer workflows, ensuring choice in models and surfaces to regain developer mindshare.

Not done yet: 'Ro-Ko' turn back the clock, script their own ending Down Under
description: On a golden Sydney evening, two men who have defined Indian cricket for over a decade found themselves writing the perfect epilogue. Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma — both long retired from Tests and T20Is — walked out one last time in blue on Australian soil. The result wasn’t just a win; it was a resurrection — a poetic reminder that their story, even now, isn’t done.

title: Skidded bike, panicked driver: How events unfolded in Kurnool bus fire
description: A tragic bus accident near Kurnool claimed 19 lives after a bus collided with a motorcycle. The pillion rider recounted how the bike skidded, leading to the fatal crash. The bus driver stated he was driving at 80-90 kmph and couldn't avoid the bike, later attempting to rescue passengers.

title: Joe Burrow injury update: Will Bengals star return in Week 8 vs Jets?
description: Joe Burrow's recovery from turf toe surgery is raising long-term concerns for the Cincinnati Bengals, with his return timeline uncertain. Experts suggest that adopting a Tom Brady-like approach to nutrition and flexibility could be crucial for Burrow's durability and preventing future injuries. The Bengals face a challenging season ahead as they await their franchise quarterback's return.

title: Hailee Steinfeld reveals 11pm emergency therapy call while Josh Allen faces Bills' slump
description: Actress Hailee Steinfeld candidly shared her struggles with career and relationship pressures, detailing a late-night therapy session prompted by doubts about balancing ambitions. Her personal newsletter, Beau Society, now on Substack, offers fans intimate insights. Meanwhile, her husband, NFL star Josh Allen, aims to lead the Buffalo Bills back to winning ways amidst their own public scrutiny.

title: Tom Aspinall hospitalized after brutal eye poke ends UFC title fight in no contest
description: Tom Aspinall's UFC heavyweight title defense against Ciryl Gane in Abu Dhabi ended as a no-contest after just four minutes due to an accidental eye poke. Aspinall was rushed to the hospital unable to see, expressing frustration over the fight's premature stoppage. Gane apologized, calling the incident an unlucky accident.

title: Doug Martin’s family speaks out after his mysterious death in police custody
description: Former NFL star Doug Martin, 36, has died in police custody following a reported break-in.  Officers attempted to detain him, leading to a struggle and his subsequent unresponsiveness.  His family revealed he battled mental illness, with a recent incident involving a jump from a rehab window.  Authorities are investigating the cause of his death.

title: Ex-Google CEO’s advice to engineers: Work hard during week, but turn off phone on weekend
description: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt advises young engineers and junior staff to disconnect from screens on weekends. He suggests dedicating a few hours to reflect on the past week and plan for the next using pen and paper. This practice, he explains, fosters accountability and clarity, leading to greater effectiveness.

title: Nick Mangold reveals chronic kidney disease, begins urgent search for donor
description: Former New York Jets star Nick Mangold, a seven-time Pro Bowler, is bravely battling chronic kidney disease. Diagnosed with a genetic defect in 2006, the 41-year-old is now undergoing dialysis and urgently seeking a type O kidney donor.  Mangold expressed gratitude for the overwhelming support from fans and the football community as he faces this significant health challenge.
